intro: Onosma zerizaminum, commonly known as the Karakorum onosma, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptation to harsh environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine pubescence, which helps reduce water loss. Onosma zerizaminum plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of alpine habitats.
